problem_text: Prove that every standard homomorphism Λ of En(R) ⊂ GLn(R) = GL(V) into Em(S) ⊂ GLm(S) = GL(W) originates from a collineation and a correlation, that is, has the form Λx = (g−1xg)f + (h−1xh)(1 − f), where g is a semilinear isomorphism VR → WS (collineation) and h is a semilinear isomorphism VR →S W′S0 (correlation). V. M. Petechuk
